summary:
The heart tree there was a great oak, its ancient limbs 
overgrown with smokeberry vines; they knelt before it to offer their...
caption: The heart tree there was a great oak, its ancient limbs overgrown with smokeberry vines; they knelt before it to offer their thanksgiving, as if it had been a weirwood. Sansa drifted to sleep as the moon rose, Arya several hours later, curling up in the grass under Ned’s cloak. All through the dark hours he kept his vigil alone. When dawn broke over the city, the dark red blooms of dragon’s breath surrounded the girls where they lay. “I dreamed of Bran,” Sansa had whispered to him. “I saw him smiling.”

summary: Dire che Arya sarebbe sopravvissuta a KL mentre se Sansa fosse stata al posto di Arya no, mi crea due problemi: Il primo è la...
body:
Dire che Arya sarebbe sopravvissuta a KL mentre se Sansa fosse stata al posto di Arya no, mi crea due problemi:

Il primo è la sottile superiorità di Arya rispetto alla sorella ( Arya può fare tutto quello che ha fatto Sansa, ma Sansa no) cosa che non condividerò mai. La seconda è la motivazione delle buone maniere.

Per la prima, ho adorato la settima stagione perchè le due sorelle finalmente trovano nelle loro differenze e mancanze non più un punto di disaccordo, ma di unione. Entrambe riconoscono cosa possono e non possono fare, affidandosi all'altra in base alle circostanze. E questo è un messaggio che mi è piaciuto tantissimo. Poichè sono i personaggi stessi a parlare di questo, sinceramente mi fido più delle loro parole, che della percezione dei fan: nessuno conosce Arya meglio di Arya stessa.


Per la motivazione:

A tre anni, Sansa era già una lady. Sempre così delicata, così desiderosa di compiacere. Più di ogni altra cosa, amava le storie di valore cavalieresco. 

L'arco narrativo della maggiore delle sorelle Stark, prende tutto ciò e lo trasforma in un incubo, esattamente come fa con Arya ed il suo arco. La storia di Sansa è una metafora della violenza domestica.  Quello che succede a KL è più di sapere le buone maniere e fare la riverenza: Sansa le sapeva fare perfettamente, ma non le è servito ad evitarsi i pestaggi. è la pazienza, la resilienza, il sapere quando tacere e quando parlare. E anche come parlare e a chi. è la conoscenza della storia e delle casate di Westeros unita al sapere ascoltare e osservare, ad averla tenuta in vita. è, ( citando il Mastino) dando a Joffrey quello che voleva senza dargli effettivamente nulla. Per questo credo che Arya all'età di nove anni, in questo frangente non sarebbe sopravvissuta: sono altre le caratteristiche richieste per questa “missione”, caratteristiche, che non vedo in Arya.

summary: S stans: I LOVE both Stark sisters equally! I can't wait for S to be queen of everything with Arya serving her! She can be the...
body:
S stans: I LOVE both Stark sisters equally! I can’t wait for S to be queen of everything with Arya serving her! She can be the Lord Commander (yes, LORD) of her queen’s guard! Here’s my manip of Arya on her knees in front of S! Oh wait, I got one better… Arya can be her sister’s sword! Yes, Arya serving as an inanimate object owned and controlled by her sister would be completely fitting for her character!

Arya fans: That completely undermines Arya’s importance in the series and makes absolutely no sense with her arc. She is one of the five main characters, not a supporting player or inanimate object for another character.

S stans: *incoherent screeching* Why are Arya stans so mean and bitter?! They just hate S! Misogynists! They don’t understand Arya like we do!

Dany fans: It would be great for Dany to have good relationships with all the Starklings, who will become her siblings once she marries Jon. Since S loves needlework and takes pride in making clothes for herself and her family, maybe she can make Dany’s wedding dress and help with her hair.

S stans: *even louder incoherent screeching* How can they reduce S to a servant!? Why does she have to be in a lesser role to Dany?! This is S hate, that’s what this is! Pure, misogynistic S hate! Dany should recognize S’s right to be queen and make her wedding dress and do her hair!

Arya fans:

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: Hoping for an Arya-Lady Stoneheart reunion
body:
Hoping for an Arya-Lady Stoneheart reunion

Spoiler alert (A Storm of Swords)

I mean, it’d really give me chills. Lady Stoneheart, the vengeance-seeking spirit, once Catelyn Stark, who’s convinced that all of children are dead, to actually see that her daughter’s alive, and radically changed. How would she react? Would that face, full of bleeding scars, pale flaccid skin, frown of some emotion? Or would she just keep closed her open throat with the hand and say “hang her”, without recognising her daughter?

And Arya? How would she act as seeing her mother reduced to that emotionless, terrifying wreck? How’d she face it? Would she remember that time when her direwolf pulled her up from the Green Fork, that white abandoned body on its side? Would she still hope for a hug, from the mother which she looked for in such a long time? Or would she just see, like Syrio Forel taught her, what that being who once was Catelyn Stark had become?

I hope George gives us this reunion in the next books, I really need it.

-sorry for my bad English, it’s not my language-

summary: A Year Of Thrones: Game of Thrones Season 5
title: A Year Of Thrones: Game of Thrones Season 5
body:
A Year Of Thrones: Game of Thrones Season 5

This year I resolved to read George R. R. Martin‘s A Song of Ice and Fire and watch HBO’s Game of Thrones, both series. For all of you who have seen the entire series and/or read all the books, here is your chance to experience it for the first time all over again!

Why I Chose it:I had tried watching the series a few times and only ever reached the half-way point of the first season. Then I was…

View On WordPress

summary: What if...
title: What if...
body: After the small council meeting, where they decided to assassinate a pregnant Daenerys and Ned resigns as Hand of the King. He thinks off sailing for Dragonstone with Sansa, Arya and only a few guards to meet Stannis and try to find out why Jon Arryn was murdered… So what would have happen if they have sailed for Dragonstone?

reblog.comment: After the small council meeting, where they decided to assassinate a pregnant Daenerys and Ned resigns as Hand of the King. He thinks off sailing for Dragonstone with Sansa, Arya and only a few guards to meet Stannis and try to find out why Jon Arryn was murdered… So what would have happen if they have sailed for Dragonstone?

blog.description: A Damn Dirty Fandom blog! Old as fuck, proper old school fandom here. Anglophiles are beloved here. #Ancientandforever

blog.name: asoiafrarepairs
blog.title: Asoiaf Rarepairs
blog.description:
Is your OTP overlooked by the fandom? Is there any pairing you wish you could find more content for? Do you like a good crackship? 
Have we got the blog for you!
All ships are welcome here, so long as they have fewer than 500 fics on AO3.
